column3: Note that this does the signature, and then checks if it didn't make sense. It might be cleaner to work out if the scriptPubKey implies segwit is used and not do the signature at all, but that seemed a bit more invasive.\n\nIt's currently missing tests to check signrawtransactionwithkey also fails correctly.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #12458 (Enforce that amount is provided for signrawtransaction prevtxs by Empact)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

This looks nearly identical to #12458. Can @ajtowns and @Empact figure out which one to move forward?\n\nIn any case, utACK 685d1d8115f61b15115d80523dd8273f0a816534. Also tested that it still works after merge with #13425.
Either works. Remaining differences are a few incidental invalid call tests and returning without updating the input on mine. @ajtowns?
utACK 685d1d8115f61b15115d80523dd8273f0a816534 tests only (haven't looked at the code changes, feel free to ignore my style nits)

Looks like this condition is false when the above is true, so a plain `else` seems more appropriate. Also, could move the `del prevtx["amount"]` out of the scopes of the if-else and drop the line below this one?
Alternatively remove the `prevtx` variable from the patch and always pass a fresh dict to `signrawtransactionwithwallet`: `prevtxs=dict(txid=txid, amount missing...)`
isn't MAX_MONEY *theoretically* a valid amount to send?
I left a similar comment in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12458#pullrequestreview-135231078, which has been addressed by @Empact in a163673.
No, `MAX_MONEY` is defined as 21000000 BTC, but the actual maximum is 20999999.97690000 BTC so you couldn't actually have `MAX_MONEY`.

I was wondering about the use of `MAX_MONEY` understanding that it doesn't represent the maximum money supply (`Note that this constant is *not* the total money supply, which in Bitcoin currently happens to be less than 21,000,000 BTC`), but still felt the need to comment on it, because it seemed a valid transaction amount to me on the basis of at least its documentation (`No amount larger than th
Please ignore the explanation why the use of `MAX_MONEY` is confusing to me. I needed @sipa's confirmation https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12458#issuecomment-403743474 to connect the dots.
@achow101 True, thanks. Ok with me then.
